segment.source: Create Your AppLocker rules (Windows 10)
segment.target: Create Your AppLocker rules (Windows 10)

segment.source: This topic for the IT professional describes what you need to know about AppLocker rules and the methods that you can to create rules.
segment.target: This topic for the IT professional describes what you need to know about AppLocker rules and the methods that you can to create rules.

segment.source: Create Your AppLocker rules
segment.target: Create Your AppLocker rules

segment.source: Applies to
segment.target: Applies to

segment.source: Windows 10
segment.target: Windows 10

segment.source: This topic for the IT professional describes what you need to know about AppLocker rules and the methods that you can to create rules.
segment.target: This topic for the IT professional describes what you need to know about AppLocker rules and the methods that you can to create rules.

segment.source: Creating AppLocker rules
segment.target: Creating AppLocker rules

segment.source: AppLocker rules apply to the targeted app, and they are the components that make up the AppLocker policy.
segment.target: AppLocker rules apply to the targeted app, and they are the components that make up the AppLocker policy.

segment.source: Depending on your IT environment and the business group that requires application control policies, setting these access rules for each application can be time-consuming and prone to error.
segment.target: Depending on your IT environment and the business group that requires application control policies, setting these access rules for each application can be time-consuming and prone to error.

segment.source: With AppLocker, you can generate rules automatically or create rules individually.
segment.target: With AppLocker, you can generate rules automatically or create rules individually.

segment.source: Creating rules that are derived from your planning document can help you avoid unintended results.
segment.target: Creating rules that are derived from your planning document can help you avoid unintended results.

segment.source: For info about this planning document and other planning activities, see AppLocker Design Guide.
segment.target: For info about this planning document and other planning activities, see AppLocker Design Guide.

segment.source: Automatically generate your rules
segment.target: Automatically generate your rules

segment.source: You can use a reference device to automatically create a set of default rules for each of the installed apps, test and modify each rule as necessary, and deploy the policies.
segment.target: You can use a reference device to automatically create a set of default rules for each of the installed apps, test and modify each rule as necessary, and deploy the policies.

segment.source: Creating most of the rules for all the installed apps gives you a starting point to build and test your policies.
segment.target: Creating most of the rules for all the installed apps gives you a starting point to build and test your policies.

segment.source: For info about performing this task, see the following topics:
segment.target: For info about performing this task, see the following topics:

segment.source: Configure the AppLocker reference device
segment.target: Configure the AppLocker reference device

segment.source: Run the Automatically Generate Rules wizard
segment.target: Run the Automatically Generate Rules wizard

segment.source: Create AppLocker default rules
segment.target: Create AppLocker default rules

segment.source: Edit AppLocker rules
segment.target: Edit AppLocker rules

segment.source: Add exceptions for an AppLocker rule
segment.target: Add exceptions for an AppLocker rule

segment.source: Create your rules individually
segment.target: Create your rules individually

segment.source: You can create rules and set the mode to Audit only for each installed app, test and update each rule as necessary, and then deploy the policies.
segment.target: You can create rules and set the mode to Audit only for each installed app, test and update each rule as necessary, and then deploy the policies.

segment.source: Creating rules individually might be best when you are targeting a small number of applications within a business group.
segment.target: Creating rules individually might be best when you are targeting a small number of applications within a business group.

segment.source: Note: AppLocker includes default rules for each rule collection.
segment.target: Note: AppLocker includes default rules for each rule collection.

segment.source: These rules are intended to help ensure that the files that are required for Windows to operate properly are allowed in an AppLocker rule collection.
segment.target: These rules are intended to help ensure that the files that are required for Windows to operate properly are allowed in an AppLocker rule collection.

segment.source: You can also edit the default rules.
segment.target: You can also edit the default rules.

segment.source: For information about creating the default rules for the Windows operating system, see Create AppLocker default rules.
segment.target: For information about creating the default rules for the Windows operating system, see Create AppLocker default rules.

segment.source: For information about performing this task, see:
segment.target: For information about performing this task, see:

segment.source: Create a rule that uses a publisher condition
segment.target: Create a rule that uses a publisher condition

segment.source: Create a rule that uses a path condition
segment.target: Create a rule that uses a path condition

segment.source: Create a rule that uses a file hash condition
segment.target: Create a rule that uses a file hash condition

segment.source: Edit AppLocker rules
segment.target: Edit AppLocker rules

segment.source: Enforce AppLocker rules
segment.target: Enforce AppLocker rules

segment.source: Configure an AppLocker policy for audit only
segment.target: Configure an AppLocker policy for audit only

segment.source: About selecting rules
segment.target: About selecting rules

segment.source: AppLocker policies are composed of distinct rules for specific apps.
segment.target: AppLocker policies are composed of distinct rules for specific apps.

segment.source: These rules are grouped by collection, and they are implemented through an AppLocker policy definition.
segment.target: These rules are grouped by collection, and they are implemented through an AppLocker policy definition.

segment.source: AppLocker policies are managed by using Group Policy or by using the Local Security Policy snap-in for a single computer.
segment.target: AppLocker policies are managed by using Group Policy or by using the Local Security Policy snap-in for a single computer.

segment.source: When you determine what types of rules to create for each of your business groups or organizational units (OUs), you should also determine what enforcement setting to use for each group.
segment.target: When you determine what types of rules to create for each of your business groups or organizational units (OUs), you should also determine what enforcement setting to use for each group.

segment.source: Certain rule types are more applicable for some apps, depending on how the apps are deployed in a specific business group.
segment.target: Certain rule types are more applicable for some apps, depending on how the apps are deployed in a specific business group.

segment.source: For info about how to determine and document your AppLocker rules, see AppLocker Design Guide.
segment.target: For info about how to determine and document your AppLocker rules, see AppLocker Design Guide.
